Package arcade.env.comp

Class Generator

java.lang.Object
arcade.env.comp.Generator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class Generator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Component
Implementation of Component for generating concentrations.

A Generator is associated with each molecule that is generated by sites through the a Sites object representing the locations of sites and the amount of concentration to add. The generator is scheduled after Sites so the lattice containing the change in concentration is updated first, before Generator updates the actual environment lattice with the change. Generator objects are independent of geometry.

Since:
2.3
Version:
2.3.9
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Generator

      public Generator​(Simulation sim, Lattice lat, MiniBox molecule)
      Creates a Generator for the given molecule.

      Constructor assigns the given lattice to the "current" array, assigns the lattice used in the corresponding diffuser to the "previous" array, and creates a new "delta" array to track how much concentration of the molecule is added. The constructor then equips the Generator instance to the Sites component, which determines where and how much of the molecules are generated.

      Parameters:
      sim - the simulation instance
      lat - the lattice of concentrations to be generated
      molecule - the molecule parameters
